condition.description:
Most kinds of arthritis cause pain and swelling in your joints. Joints are places where two bones meet, such as your elbow or knee. Infectious arthritis is an infection in the joint. The infection comes from a bacterial, viral, or fungal infection that spreads from another part of the body. Symptoms of infectious arthritis include

  • Intense pain in the joint
  • Joint redness and swelling
  • Chills and fever
  • Inability to move the area with the infected joint

One type of infectious arthritis is reactive arthritis. The reaction is to an infection somewhere else in your body. The joint is usually the knee, ankle, or toe. Sometimes, reactive arthritis is set off by an infection in the bladder, or in the urethra, which carries urine out of the body. In women, an infection in the vagina can cause the reaction. For both men and women, it can start with bacteria passed on during sex. Another form of reactive arthritis starts with eating food or handling something that has bacteria on it.

To diagnose infectious arthritis, your health care provider may do tests of your blood, urine, and joint fluid. Treatment includes medicines and sometimes surgery.
condition.name: Septic arthritis

carousel_items: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Avoid taking this by itself with dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt) or with juice with calcium.
Take this medication at least 2 hours before or 6 hours after any antacids with magnesium or aluminum or with any vitamins with calcium, iron or zinc.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Limit your caffeine intake while taking this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Ciprofloxacin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Ciprofloxacin is a good and cheap antibiotic to treat many types of bacterial infections. However, you have to reduce your caffeine intake, and have to protect yourself from the sun.
downsides: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
If you have caffeine while on Ciprofloxacin, you may noticed increased effects of the caffeine.
Ciprofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.

downsides_processed.orig: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
If you have caffeine while on Ciprofloxacin, you may noticed increased effects of the caffeine.
Ciprofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.

upsides: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

userStories.tip: Gave me anxiety attacks, low blood sugar, wrist pain, rapid heart beat, insomnia, and popping sounds in different parts of my body.  After 3 days, I never felt like I was getting better, only worse.  I'm never taking it again.
Tore rotator cuff, still healing months later

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Destroyed my digestive system gut flora in the process.. It's not just about possible diarrhea when you are on it...the side effects can last weeks. I'm still trying to get my digestive system working properly again.

drugs.name: Cipro

off-label_indications.indication: Infection or inflammatory reaction from an artificial joint or implant or graft

carousel_items_processed.orig: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Avoid taking this by itself with dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt) or with juice with calcium.
Take this medication at least 2 hours before or 6 hours after any antacids with magnesium or aluminum or with any vitamins with calcium, iron or zinc.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Limit your caffeine intake while taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Tendon rupture
risks_warnings.description: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening of myasthenia gravis
risks_warnings.description: If you've had myasthenia gravis, contact your doctor for alternatives. You can experience worsening of your symptoms.

description_processed.orig: If you've had myasthenia gravis, contact your doctor for alternatives. You can experience worsening of your symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Ciprofloxacin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Ciprofloxacin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage and it can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage and it can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mood
risks_warnings.description: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Ciprofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Ciprofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

points.name: Abdominal pain
points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)

carousel_items: Don't drink any alcohol while on this (and don't even use mouthwash with alcohol in it) for at least 3 days after using Metronidazole since it can cause a serious reaction in your stomach and make you throw up.
Take this medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Don't stop taking it early, or the bacteria left in your body will become resistant to future antibiotics you'll take.
If you're taking the extended release (ER) form, take it 1 hour before or 2 hours after you eat.

basics.benefits_moa: Metronidazole is an antibiotic that kills bacteria by cutting off their supply of energy and ruining their DNA.
basics.bottom_line: Metronidazole is a very good way to treat certain bacteria infections, but you can't have any alcohol while on it since it'll make you throw up. A lot.
downsides: You can't drink alcohol while on this medication, and for at least 3 days after you finish Metronidazole.
If you're breastfeeding, you'll need to switch to a formula to feed your baby for at least 3 days after you finish taking Metronidazole.
Side effects include nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and headache.
Your urine can turn a dark red color while on Metronidazole.
The oral version of Flagyl 375 mg is only available as brand name so this particular form can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: You can't drink alcohol while on this medication, and for at least 3 days after you finish Metronidazole.
If you're breastfeeding, you'll need to switch to a formula to feed your baby for at least 3 days after you finish taking Metronidazole.
Side effects include nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and headache.
Your urine can turn a dark red color while on Metronidazole.
The oral version of Flagyl 375 mg is only available as brand name so this particular form can be expensive.

upsides: Metronidazole is extremely effective in killing bacteria.
Unlike many other antibiotics, Metronidazole is less likely to make bacteria resistant to the medication.
Available in different forms including a topical (skin) version, a vaginal version, and multiple oral (by mouth) versions.
Most forms are available as a generic, so it is relatively cheap.

upsides_processed.orig: Metronidazole is extremely effective in killing bacteria.
Unlike many other antibiotics, Metronidazole is less likely to make bacteria resistant to the medication.
Available in different forms including a topical (skin) version, a vaginal version, and multiple oral (by mouth) versions.
Most forms are available as a generic, so it is relatively cheap.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: If you are hypersensitive to medications (i.e., several drug allergies), PLEASE check with your medical professional for alternatives. Side effect (arthralgia - joint pain) are STILL present after 2.5 days of taking, 7 weeks later!
userStories.indication: Was given when PID was suspected (ended up not being)

drugs.name: Flagyl

labeled_indications.indication: Colorectal infection prevention after a surgery

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't drink any alcohol while on this (and don't even use mouthwash with alcohol in it) for at least 3 days after using Metronidazole since it can cause a serious reaction in your stomach and make you throw up.
Take this medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Don't stop taking it early, or the bacteria left in your body will become resistant to future antibiotics you'll take.
If you're taking the extended release (ER) form, take it 1 hour before or 2 hours after you eat.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mental status | Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had changes in their mental status or suffered nerve damage. This is rare, and usually goes away after Metronidazole is stopped. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel confused, have trouble walking, feel dizzy, or feel numbness or tingling.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had changes in their mental status or suffered nerve damage. This is rare, and usually goes away after Metronidazole is stopped. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel confused, have trouble walking, feel dizzy, or feel numbness or tingling.

risks_warnings.title: Aseptic meningitis
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had aseptic meningitis, or an inflammation along the coverings of the brain. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you have a very painful headache, sensitivity to light, loss of appetite or vomiting once you start taking Metronidazole.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had aseptic meningitis, or an inflammation along the coverings of the brain. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you have a very painful headache, sensitivity to light, loss of appetite or vomiting once you start taking Metronidazole.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Clinical studies involving mice and rats have shown that exposure to Metronidazole can cause cancer in these animals. However, studies haven't shown that this is true in humans, but Metronidazole should only be given when your doctor thinks it's necessary.

description_processed.orig: Clinical studies involving mice and rats have shown that exposure to Metronidazole can cause cancer in these animals. However, studies haven't shown that this is true in humans, but Metronidazole should only be given when your doctor thinks it's necessary.
